thread.title: Fired up

author: Hugh Johnson
title: Fired up
text:
The temperature dropped last night, and our hard-working snowmakers jumped into action. We are presently making snow on Lower Chilcoot and Mulcahy’s Link. We received an inch of new snow in the past 24 hours, 9 inches in the week, and 119 inches this season. We plan to have 4 lifts operating tomorrow: Sterling, Village, Mogul Mouse’s Magic, and Sir Henry’s Slider. The Village Lift and Sterling Lift will open at 8 am. Mogul Mouse’s Magic Lift will open at 9 am. Our talented grooming staff will be busy tonight. We plan to have 20 trails groomed for tomorrow, including Smugglers’ Alley, Midway, Meadowlark, Black Snake, and Howie’s Wanderer for a total of 100 acres of freshly groomed terrain. Surface conditions are machine groomed and loose granular with average base depths of 12 to 42 inches. Currently, it is cloudy and 15 degrees at the summit of Sterling. Tomorrow’s forecast is cloudy skies with a chance of snow showers early, breezy, a high of 29 degrees at the base and 24 degrees at higher elevations. Temperatures will be falling throughout the day.
Tomorrow is the shortest day of the year, and we are going to celebrate!
Winter Solstice Party – Smuggs Style!
December 21 , 10:00 am – 2:00 pm
Winter Solstice Party on the Stache Deck!
We’re turning the shortest day of the year into one of the most epic! Join us Sunday at the Madonna/Sterling Base Lodge for a high-energy celebration of winter, sunshine, and snow.
Spot the Costumed Solsticians!
From 10:00 am – 1:00 pm, our Skiing & Riding Solsticians will be cruising the mountain — catch them and score raffle tickets for a shot at awesome prizes!
Party on the Stache Deck | 12:00 noon – 2:00 pm
DJ Jammin’ Sam brings the beats while we fire up the barbecue and pour the frosty brews. Good vibes guaranteed.
Raffle Drawing | 1:30 pm
Stick around — your raffle ticket could be the lucky one!
It’s all happening at the Madonna/Sterling Base Lodge. Come for the turns, stay for the tunes, and celebrate the solstice in true Smuggs style.
